DataElement.preferredName: Person Child-Pugh Classification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient has liver disease categorized by the Child Pugh system that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Child-Pugh Classification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the Child-Pugh classification, used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation, for a person as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Child-Pugh Classification Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. Although it was originally used to predict mortality during surgery, it is now used to determine the prognosis, as well as the required strength of treatment and the necessity of liver transplantation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have Child Pugh
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Child Pugh class A or B7 liver disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cirrhosis with Child-Pugh score of B or C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Child-Pugh class C cirrhosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have hepatic insufficiency [i.e. Child-Pugh Score A (mild), Child-Pugh Score B (moderate) or Child-Pugh Score C (severe)] according to Child-Pugh Criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known hepatic insufficiency [i.e. Child-Pugh Score A (mild), Child-Pugh Score B (moderate) or Child-Pugh Score C (severe)] according to Child-Pugh Criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have moderate or severe hepatic impairment (i.e., Child-Pugh B or C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known, clinically significant history of liver disease consistent with Child Pugh Class B or C, including active viral or other hepatitis (e.g., positive for hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] or hepatitis C virus [HCV] antibody at screening), or cirrhosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe hepatic impairment (i.e., Child-Pugh C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known clinically significant history of liver disease consistent with Child Pugh Class B or C, including active viral or other hepatitis (e.g., positive for hepatitis B surface antigen [HbsAg] or hepatitis C virus [HCV] antibody at screening), current drug or alcohol abuse, or cirrhosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have moderate to severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh B or C)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have moderate hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh Class B or C)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2022.11.29 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001742. ak
